summary: Elizabeth Brown Norris was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents list her name, salary, and pay during those periods, indicating she was employed by the committee during that time. The specific role she held within the SCA is not detailed in these documents.
significance: Elizabeth Brown Norris's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation, though the extent and nature of her role are not specified in the provided documents.
